title: Gary Lineker SLAMS decision to sack Claudio Ranieri - "Inexplicable, unforgivable and gut-wrenchingly sad"
text:
Lineker has slammed the decision (Photo: BT SPORT;GETTY) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Gary Lineker has slammed Leicester City for sacking Claudio Ranieri. 
The Foxes fan , who sported underwear on Match of the Day after the Italian led them to their first title last season, called the decision: "Inexplicable, unforgivable and gut-wrenchingly sad." 
The club confirmed they had parted company with the manager in a statement on their website. 
It was only nine months ago the Italian guided the Foxes to their first Premier League title, but things have been a little different this season. 
Leicester find themselves one point away from the drop zone and a relegation battle in the business end of the season looks very likely. Ranieri lifts the Premier League trophy last season (Photo: Getty Images) Ranieri hugs Jamie Vardy after the defeat to Sevilla (Photo: REUTERS) 
Leicester City released a statement confirming the Italian was no longer in charge of the club. 
Vice Chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha said: "This has been the most difficult decision we have had to make in nearly seven years since King Power took ownership of Leicester City. 
"But we are duty-bound to put the Club's long-term interests above all sense of personal sentiment, no matter how strong that might be." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
